K is for Kill

Kill refers to destroying objects

Take a look at the sprites in the game. The middle sprite has been given a random velocity and has 100% bounce. The left and right sprite are immovable. The middle sprite will be killed if it collides with either the left or right sprite. A timer will be used to revive the middle sprite one second after it is killed.

Killing a sprite is a way to remove the sprite from the game. This causes the sprite to be hidden and all interactions with the sprite are disabled. The sprite can be revived, in which cause it is made visible and can interact with the rest of the world.

References

The following other lessons have been referenced:

  • B is for Bounce
  • C is for Collision
  • I is for Immovable
  • S is for Sprite
  • T is for Timer
  • V is for Velocity
